meanings.definition: To make persistent demands on someone, especially for payment of a debt.
meanings.sent1: The landlord duns the tenant for the rent every month.
meanings.sent2: She duns her brother to return the money he borrowed.
meanings.sent3: The cat duns the owner for treats by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The rain duns on the roof, demanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The teacher duns the students for their homework, reminding them daily.

meanings.sent1: The old sofa had a duns hue that blended with the room.
meanings.sent2: She painted the walls in a calming duns shade.
meanings.sent3: The duns of the rock resembled the color of wet sand.
meanings.sent4: The duns of the clouds signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The artist mixed black and white to create a beautiful duns tone for the painting.
